analytic.title: Hierarchical Transformation of Space in the Visual System

abstract.p: Neurons encoding simple visual features in area VI such as orientation, direction of motion and color are organized in retinotopic maps. However , recent physiological experiments have shown that the responses of many neurons in VI and other cortical areas are modulated by the direction of gaze. We have developed a neural network model of the visual cortex to explore the hypothesis that visual features are encoded in head-centered coordinates at early stages of visual processing. New experiments are suggested for testing this hypothesis using electrical stimulations and psychophysical observations.
